Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on . Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan is
required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must
include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan
• (1) The social service worker shall complete,
sign, and date an initial treatment plan for each
resident within 30 calendar days of admission.
One out of the three currently placed youth files reviewed did not have a timely
completed initial service plan.
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
• (1)An institution shall maintain employee records
for each employee and shall include
documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in
this rule:
• (e) Three dated references which are
obtained prior to employment from
persons unrelated to the employee and
which are less than 12 months old.
One out of the seven newly hired staff files reviewed did not have three dated
references completed prior to hire.
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
• (1)An institution shall maintain employee records
for each employee and shall include
documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in
this rule:
• (g) If the employee has criminal
convictions, the institution shall complete
a written evaluation of the convictions that

addresses the nature of the conviction,
the length of time since the conviction,
and the relationship of the conviction to
regulated activity for the purpose of
determining suitability for employment in
the institution.
One out of one applicable newly hired staff file reviewed did not have a statement
from the facility regarding the prospective employee’s past criminal convictions.
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
• (1)An institution shall maintain employee records
for each employee and shall include
documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in
this rule:
• (h) A statement from the employee
regarding any convictions.
One out of one applicable newly hired staff files reviewed did not have a
statement from the employee regarding their past criminal convictions.
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
• (1)An institution shall maintain employee records
for each employee and shall include
documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in
this rule:
• (j) A written evaluation of the employee's
performance within 30 days of the
completion of the probationary period or
within 180 days, whichever is less, and a
written evaluation of the employee's
performance annually thereafter.
Four out of the seven applicable employee files reviewed did not have a
performance evaluation completed in a timely manner.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical Assistance was offered regarding the new fingerprinting process
requirements for new staff within CCI facilities.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was offered regarding necessary description of the input received
from necessary parties in the development of treatment plans.
• Consultation was offered regarding the description of parental visitation within
treatment plans.
• Consultation was offered regarding clarity in the description of aftercare services
on discharge services plans.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The previous year’s interim inspection results in an approved Corrective Action
Plan dated 03/14/2024. This plan contained three rule violations. The first was
regarding the timeliness of training documentation being completed for newly
hired staff. No concerns were noted regarding this rule during this inspection.
The second rule violation was regarding the timeliness of updated service plans
for youth. USPs reviewed during this inspection were all timely and in
compliance. The third rule violation was regarding content within discharge plan
reports for youth. Discharge plans reviewed for this inspection did not present
any concern and were in compliance.
Special Investigation #2024SIC0001325 was approved on 06/28/2024 and the
resulting CAP was approved on 09/25/2024. The CAP contained action planning
regarding the completion and timeliness of incident reporting notifications. There
have been no concerns regarding the facility's timeliness of informing applicable
parties of incidents such as AWOLs or youth being transported to the hospital.

Financial Overview
Yearly budgeting and financial overviews were provided, and no concerns were
noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator provided an assessment dated 02/04/2025. In this
assessment she reviewed compliance for the calendar year of 2024. Areas of
non-compliance included timeliness of incident reports, and the assessment
detailed the facility's accompanying action plan. The facility had limited unplanned
discharges. One area that helped with compliance was the reduced turnover of
staffing within the facility.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff were interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-face visit at the facility on
01/30/2025. All staff reported that the program is meeting all of the youth needs.
Staff also reported the youth participate in group therapy, exercise, movie night
and outings outside of the facility. A staff member reported they would like a staff
meeting with all employees but understands this may difficult due to the different
shifts. All staff stated that they felt supported by management.
Youth were interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-face visit at the facility on
01/30/2025. The youth reported positive experiences participating in the program.
The youth did state they don't like when they get LOP's (loss of privileges)
because they are not allowed to do anything. Each youth named the same staff
member as their favorite staff member, and they do enjoy the food at the program.
They all stated that their basic needs were being met and they felt safe in the
program.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walkthrough was completed during the unannounced, face-to-face visit to the
facility on 01/14/2025. No concerns were noted. Bedrooms were viewed for the
youth and they were clean and organized. The kitchen area was toured and there
were no food items found to be out of date. The kitchen and all other necessary
supplies for the youth were well stocked. Medication was viewed during an
unannounced, face-to-face visit on 01/30/2025 and was stored properly. Cleaning
supplies for the facility were stored in a safe manner as well.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
